result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Aaron Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment, unless medical documentation says otherwise.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Not to enter any establishment that sells alcohol.   Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
